title: Alexis Young
author: Alexis Young
content: Someone in Newzeland scammed me, and owes me bigI know his Name, Phone number, and social media (He started deleting his social media profiles now to run away)I know where he works & His phone numberAnybody who can track him down/Get his family details/Threaten him over calls n all to get my money backI can pay him upto $1500Don't msg me UNLESS you're serious! So only tell me if you're seriousMy telegram is : @sloppybtc

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: Alexis Young on May 26, 2022, 03:27:03 AMAnybody who can track him down/Get his family details/Threaten him over calls n all to get my money backThis is very alarming and unethical if someone will really do the job for you. Ask the local authority of New Zealand to trace him for you if he really has huge money borrowed from you. I understand the frustration but you should do this the right way or else he will keep hiding from you since he is far away from you. Ask someone to file the complaints on their local police department and give the proof of all your transaction and conversation to make this job offer realistic. Honestly, no one in the right mind will do this task for just 1500$ and use escrow for the payment since you have a negative reputation.

comments.author: lombok
comments.body: Based on the negative trust received by the OP, probably a lot of people wouldn't trust him to do that. And maybe a lot of people will say that maybe it's karma from what the OP did if you look at history in his negative beliefs.Quote from: Beparanf on May 26, 2022, 03:34:16 AMAsk the local authority of New Zealand to trace him for you if he really has huge money borrowed from you. Exactly what Beparanf said, report it to the local police to take care of it if the OP loses a lot of money. This is more legal and quicker to process because the local police know what they are going to do with the procedures they have in place.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: There are few questions to be asked;1. Was the business transacted on this forum or was out of the platform?2. Was there any written agreements or any means to pay back or collateral that possesses his name's, location and states?3. What was your terms and conditions before giving out or borrowing your money to him/she?4. Were you a registered money lender?If all these could be clearly answered then I will say nothing can be done from this forum, maybe any one can find it interesting to work with you but I must say your chances are very slime so report him to the police maybe they could help and track him before leaving the state or country, this could be how huge is the money before they would pick interest and seriously work with you.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Alexis Young on May 26, 2022, 03:27:03 AMI know his Name, Phone number, and social media (He started deleting his social media profiles now to run away)I know where he works & His phone numberYou know practically everything about the person who owes you money, and you are looking for someone else to collect debts for you by calling that person and his family members? You do not take into account that everything about that person may be false, but also that the threats are taken very seriously even if they come over the phone. Is $1500 worthwhile if someone ends up in jail for threatening someone?My advice is: if you already have the money to share it with some strangers, then get a passport, buy a ticket to NZ and when you get there hire a lawyer and report everything to the police.

comments.body: Man if this person owes you big just file a case on him " Large Scale staffa " or just " staffa " and let the police and FBI hunt him down. But then if you lend him a crypto that is subject for court to consider since they all think that crypto is an internet fantasy lol
